00184   class Exception;
00185 
00186   // Helpers to render a exception message a la IO manipulators
00187   struct ExceptionMessageRenderer {
00188     ExceptionMessageRenderer(const Exception &e) : ex(e) { }
00189 
00190     std::ostream &render(std::ostream &out) const;
00191 
00192     const Exception &ex;
00193   };
00194 
00195   struct ExceptionMessagesRenderer {
00196     ExceptionMessagesRenderer(const Exception &e, const char *sep = ": ")
00197       : ex(e), separator(sep) { }
00198 
00199     std::ostream &render(std::ostream &out) const;
00200 
00201     const Exception &ex;
00202     const char *separator;
00203   };
00204 
00209   class Exception : public std::runtime_error {
00210     const Exception &operator=(const Exception &); // not assignable
00211 
00212     int m_error;
00213     int m_line;
00214     const char *m_func;
00215     const char *m_file;
00216 
00217   public:
00218     typedef std::runtime_error Parent;
00219 
00220     Exception(int error, int l = 0, const char *fn = 0, const char *fl = 0)
00221       : Parent(""), m_error(error), m_line(l), m_func(fn), m_file(fl), prev(0)
00222       { }
00223     Exception(int error, const String &msg, int l = 0, const char *fn = 0,
00224               const char *fl = 0)
00225       : Parent(msg), m_error(error), m_line(l), m_func(fn), m_file(fl), prev(0)
00226       { }
00227     Exception(int error, const String &msg, const Exception &ex,
00228               int l = 0, const char *fn = 0, const char *fl = 0)
00229       : Parent(msg), m_error(error), m_line(l), m_func(fn), m_file(fl),
00230         prev(new Exception(ex)) { }
00231     // copy ctor is required for exceptions
00232     Exception(const Exception &ex) : Parent(ex), m_error(ex.m_error),
00233         m_line(ex.m_line), m_func(ex.m_func), m_file(ex.m_file) {
00234       prev = ex.prev ? new Exception(*ex.prev) : 0;
00235     }
00236     ~Exception() throw() { delete prev; prev = 0; }
00237 
00238     int code() const { return m_error; }
00239     int line() const { return m_line; }
00240     const char *func() const { return m_func; }
00241     const char *file() const { return m_file; }
00242 
00243     // render message
00244     virtual std::ostream &render_message(std::ostream &out) const {
00245       return out << what(); // override for custom exceptions
00246     }
00247 
00248     // render messages for the entire exception chain
00249     virtual std::ostream &
00250     render_messages(std::ostream &out, const char *sep) const;
00251 
00252     ExceptionMessageRenderer message() const {
00253       return ExceptionMessageRenderer(*this);
00254     }
00255 
00256     ExceptionMessagesRenderer messages(const char *sep = ": ") const {
00257       return ExceptionMessagesRenderer(*this, sep);
00258     }
00259 
00260     Exception *prev;    // exception chain/list
00261   };
00262 
00263 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &out, const Exception &);
00264 
00265 inline std::ostream &
00266 ExceptionMessageRenderer::render(std::ostream &out) const {
00267   return ex.render_message(out);
00268 }
00269 
00270 inline std::ostream &
00271 ExceptionMessagesRenderer::render(std::ostream &out) const {
00272   return ex.render_messages(out, separator);
00273 }
00274 
00275 inline std::ostream &
00276 operator<<(std::ostream &out, const ExceptionMessageRenderer &r) {
00277   return r.render(out);
00278 }
00279 
00280 inline std::ostream &
00281 operator<<(std::ostream &out, const ExceptionMessagesRenderer &r) {
00282   return r.render(out);
00283 }
00284 
00288 #define HT_EXCEPTION(_code_, _msg_) \
00289   Exception(_code_, _msg_, __LINE__, HT_FUNC, __FILE__)
00290 
00291 #define HT_EXCEPTION2(_code_, _ex_, _msg_) \
00292   Exception(_code_, _msg_, _ex_, __LINE__, HT_FUNC, __FILE__)
00293 
00294 #define HT_THROW(_code_, _msg_) throw HT_EXCEPTION(_code_, _msg_)
00295 #define HT_THROW_(_code_) HT_THROW(_code_, "")
00296 #define HT_THROW2(_code_, _ex_, _msg_) throw HT_EXCEPTION2(_code_, _ex_, _msg_)
00297 #define HT_THROW2_(_code_, _ex_) HT_THROW2(_code_, _ex_, "")
00298 
00299 #define HT_THROWF(_code_, _fmt_, ...) \
00300   throw HT_EXCEPTION(_code_, format(_fmt_, __VA_ARGS__))
00301 
00302 #define HT_THROW2F(_code_, _ex_, _fmt_, ...) \
00303   throw HT_EXCEPTION2(_code_, _ex_, format(_fmt_, __VA_ARGS__))
00304 
00305 #define HT_RETHROWF(_fmt_, ...) \
00306   catch (Exception &e) { HT_THROW2F(e.code(), e, _fmt_, __VA_ARGS__); } \
00307   catch (std::bad_alloc &e) { \
00308     HT_THROWF(Error::BAD_MEMORY_ALLOCATION, _fmt_, __VA_ARGS__); \
00309   } \
00310   catch (std::exception &e) { \
00311     HT_THROWF(Error::EXTERNAL, "caught std::exception: %s " _fmt_,  e.what(), \
00312               __VA_ARGS__); \
00313   } \
00314   catch (...) { \
00315     HT_ERRORF("caught unknown exception " _fmt_, __VA_ARGS__); \
00316     throw; \
00317   }
00318 
00319 #define HT_RETHROW(_s_) HT_RETHROWF("%s", _s_)
00320 #define HT_RETHROW_ HT_RETHROW("")
00321 
00322 #define HT_TRY(_s_, _code_) do { \
00323   try { _code_; } \
00324   HT_RETHROW(_s_) \
00325 } while (0)
00326 
00327 
00328 // For catching exceptions in destructors
00329 #define HT_LOG_EXCEPTION(_s_) \
00330   catch (Exception &e) { HT_ERROR_OUT << e <<", "<< _s_ << HT_END; } \
00331   catch (std::bad_alloc &e) { \
00332     HT_ERROR_OUT <<"Out of memory, "<< _s_ << HT_END; } \
00333   catch (std::exception &e) { \
00334     HT_ERROR_OUT <<"Caught exception: "<< e.what() <<", "<< _s_ << HT_END; } \
00335   catch (...) { \
00336     HT_ERROR_OUT <<"Caught unknown exception, "<< _s_ << HT_END; }
00337 
00338 #define HT_TRY_OR_LOG(_s_, _code_) do { \
00339   try { _code_; } \
00340   HT_LOG_EXCEPTION(_s_) \
00341 } while (0)
00342
